Sentencas: Cerium doped strontium manganese (SrMn0.97Ce0.03O3) ceramics was prepared by solid state reaction route.
Titulo: Structural and Electrical Characterization of SrMn0.97Ce0.03O3 Ceramics

Sentencas: The structural analysis suggests a hexagonal structure (P63/mmc) with refine lattice constants are; a = b = 0.5532 nm, c = 0.9108 nm, alpha = beta = 90 degrees, gamma = 120 degrees, rho = 5.42 g/cm(3), and V = 241.38 x 10(6) pm(3).
Titulo: Structural and Electrical Characterization of SrMn0.97Ce0.03O3 Ceramics

Sentencas: The average crystallite size and micro-strain in the material are 35.8 nm and 0.0717%, respectively.
Titulo: Structural and Electrical Characterization of SrMn0.97Ce0.03O3 Ceramics

Sentencas: The study of SEM micrograph suggests a highly dense material with small porosity.
Titulo: Structural and Electrical Characterization of SrMn0.97Ce0.03O3 Ceramics

Sentencas: It is clearly noticed that material has well defined grains surrounded by grain boundaries with average grain size is 9.5 mu m, which play important role to define electrical properties.
Titulo: Structural and Electrical Characterization of SrMn0.97Ce0.03O3 Ceramics

Sentencas: Activation energy increases from 275 meV to 504 meV with temperature in the material confirms a thermally activated conduction process, which is also well supported from decreasing tendency of diameter of Nyquist plots.
Titulo: Structural and Electrical Characterization of SrMn0.97Ce0.03O3 Ceramics

Sentencas: Temperature dependent relaxation time graph suggests two conduction channels (E-a1=212 meV & E-a2 = 51 meV) i.e. immobile charge carriers at low-temperature while defects at higher temperature.
Titulo: Structural and Electrical Characterization of SrMn0.97Ce0.03O3 Ceramics

Sentencas: The gap between the peak of Z '' and M '' is becoming wider with temperature confirming non-Debye-type relaxation character.
Titulo: Structural and Electrical Characterization of SrMn0.97Ce0.03O3 Ceramics

Sentencas: The bulk resistance (R-b) decreases from 8.622 x 10(3)
Titulo: Structural and Electrical Characterization of SrMn0.97Ce0.03O3 Ceramics

Sentencas: Omega at 25 degrees C to 1.380 x 10(2) Omega at 500 degrees C after fitting (CQR) (CR) model with Nyquist plot supporting the NTCR behavior of the material, which is well supported from Cole-Cole plots.
Titulo: Structural and Electrical Characterization of SrMn0.97Ce0.03O3 Ceramics

Sentencas: Prepared material can be used in cathode for making solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) and biosensors.
Titulo: Structural and Electrical Characterization of SrMn0.97Ce0.03O3 Ceramics
